channel.title: Comments on: Ionic Framework, Cordova and Yeoman – Loved One Notifier
channel.description: Knowing is different & Doing is different

item.title: By: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.dc:creator: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.description: No, not the one shown here. You need to add a background plugin like https://github.com/phpsa/cbsp and it should do fine.
item.content:encoded: No, not the one shown here. You need to add a background plugin like https://github.com/phpsa/cbsp and it should do fine.

item.title: By: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.dc:creator: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.description: The sms object is made available globally when you run <code>phonegap local plugin add https://github.com/aharris88/phonegap-sms-plugin.git</code>.
item.content:encoded: The sms object is made available globally when you run phonegap local plugin add https://github.com/aharris88/phonegap-sms-plugin.git.

item.title: By: Daniel
item.dc:creator: Daniel
item.content:encoded:
Thanks for sharing. It helps me a lot.
I have a quick question In the controllers.js at line 80:

sms.send(number, message, intent, success, error);

Where does the ‘sms’ come from?

Can I test on a Iphone??

item.title: By: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.dc:creator: Arvind Ravulavaru
item.description:
Well, the Yeoman generator forces a better development workflow when compared with Ionic CLI.
In the ionic generator, you work inside the <code>www</code> directory but when you use the yeoman generator, you work inside the <code>app</code> directory and then push the production ready code into <code>www</code> directory. This is better workflow compared to the Ionic CLI. Keeps your dev. code vs. prod. code separate.
item.content:encoded:
Well, the Yeoman generator forces a better development workflow when compared with Ionic CLI.

In the ionic generator, you work inside the www directory but when you use the yeoman generator, you work inside the app directory and then push the production ready code into www directory. This is better workflow compared to the Ionic CLI. Keeps your dev. code vs. prod. code separate.
